|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 1 GiB |ram1chip = Micron;MT41K256M16TW-107; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43684; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad2txchains = 4 |rad2rxchains = 4 |rad2sstreams = 4 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ax |rad2ax = 2400 |rad2ac = 1733 |nqam2 = 1000 |rad2n = 600 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 2.4 or 5 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== ''Indoor Plenum Rated AP Dual Radio''
*4×4 + 4×4 802.11ax radios *2x Ethernet ports (2.5G and 1G) *USB, Bluetooth low energy *Software definable radio (Dual 5GHz) *Powered by PoE+ or DC power
It appears to be possible to configure the second radio for either 2.4GHz or 5GHz operation. Some sort of Broadcom chip appears to drive the 2.5 GbE port.
==Links of Interest== ===News=== *[https://blog.aerohive.com/aerohive-announces-three-802-11ax-access-points/ ''Aerohive announces three 802.11ax access points'' on '''Aerohive''' blog] *[https://wifinowevents.com/news-and-blog/aerohive-announces-release-802-11ax-ap-family/ ''Aerohive announces release of 802.11ax AP family'' on '''Wi-Fi Now'''] :^ Source of Broadcom chip guess
